citations.narrative:
On four separate days during the month of July 2024, a Roborovski hamster was found lodged between the cage floor
and a metal running wheel mounted in a suspended fashion from the top of the cage. The first occurrence was on
07/02/2024 and the hamster was found dead in the cage, lodged beneath the wheel with leg injuries. Three more
hamsters, alive and in good condition, were also found trapped; the last one occurring although adjustments were made
to increase clearance beneath the wheel. The placement of this enrichment item within the enclosure did not allow
sufficient freedom of movement for the animals thus resulting in animal entrapment and discomfort as well as the death of
one hamster. Primary enclosures for hamsters must be constructed and maintained so as to provide sufficient space for
each hamster to make normal postural adjustments with adequate freedom of movement. Corrected prior to the time of
inspection with all wheels having been removed.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
